DESC.PARA: The multi-blackbody "Self-IrRadiated Funnel" model is designed to model optically-thick outflow-dominated accretion. The basic idea is simple: you just assume a lot of matter, angular momentum and energy emerges in a limited volume. Momentum conservation leads to non-sphericity of the flow that has subsequently conical (funnel-like) shape. The model calculates temperature distribution at the funnel walls (taking into account irradiation by iterative process) and the outer photosphere. We also assume that inside the cone there is a deep pseudo-photosphere. Relativistic boosts are taken into account for high velocities. For a comprehensive description of the physical model, see: Abolmasov, P., Karpov, S. and Kotani, T. PASJ, 61, 2, 213.
This is an additive model component.

ROW.DATA: inner temperature (at the inner, inside-the-funnel photosphere)
inner (inside-the-funnel photosphere) radius in "spherisation radius" units (the latter is defined as 3 K Mdot / Omega_f c).
outer photosphere radius in "spherisation radius" units.
inclination angle of the funnel. Affects mainly self-occultation and relativistic boost effects.
velocity law exponent, v goes as r^valpha
adiabatic index. It affects the inner, hotter parts of the flow, therefore it is set to 4/3 by default.
